message:
In the last decade, AFP has frequently reported on well-funded U.S. and international organizations that are set up for the sole purpose of smearing decent patriotic Americans and others as “haters” and “racists,” simply because they do not agree with these groups’ liberal outlook.

‎"The danger here is that these so-called 'civil right groups' often work closely with law enforcement agencies, using paid informants to infiltrate meetings & spy on people. Detailed information is collected & kept in files or turned over to police to help facilitate lawsuits & prosecutions— even prison sentences."

"AFP had the chance recently to interview Mark Potok, the spokesperson for Morris Dees’s Southern Poverty Law Center, a multi-million-dollar operation that sees itself as America’s premier civil rights organization, but more broadly exists to pigeonhole Americans into subjective categories of 'hate.'”

"Potok, director of the SPLC's 'Intelligence Project,' tasked with monitoring 'hate groups' & 'extremists,' freely admitted to AFP that the method SPLC staffers use for determining 'hate' is not at all a science."

"This admission... could be seen as alarming. A subjective, therefore inaccurate 'hate' judgment from Potok & company at the SPLC could ruin someone’s life or even become a jail sentence..."

http://www.americanfreepress.net/html/splc_hate_253.html
